title: Plant These 8 Perennial Vegetables to Get a Harvest Each Year #shorts

tasks.task: Plant perennial vegetables in a garden.
subtasks: Research and choose perennial vegetables for the garden.
Purchase or obtain perennial vegetable plants or seeds.
Prepare the garden soil by tilling or turning it.
Dig planting holes for the selected perennial vegetables.
Plant the perennial vegetables in the prepared soil.
Water the newly planted vegetables thoroughly.
Mulch around the plants to retain moisture and suppress weeds.

tasks.task: Maintain and care for perennial garden.
subtasks: Regularly water the plants during dry periods.
Apply mulch as needed to retain moisture.
Monitor for weeds and remove them as necessary.
Check for pests and diseases, and address them if present.
Harvest the perennial vegetables as they mature, such as asparagus spears, sunchokes, etc.
Enjoy long-lasting harvests from the established perennial garden.
